Articles.Content:
As you may or may not be aware of, we've just recently bought two brand new servers to handle a change in services, and to help with load spreading. But the great news, is that KSP has gone to the cloud! We'll be using Amazon CloudFront (I think) to handle release days.

-DR
On another note, the forums will go down today for a migraiton.

Finally!

No more hours of trying to download the new version.

Thanx!

No more waiting for downloading the new version and waiting 3 days for the forums to come back up.

Thanks very much !

awesome, just as I suggested

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/16252-Kerbal-Space-Program-For-Steam-Greenlight?p=230089&viewfull=1#post230089

Cloud stuff is awesome. Knowing you can command hundreds of boxes (Meh ok... VM instances) with a single command, even while working in a medium sized business always gives me the goosebumps.

A lot of other people suggested it as well, here and in IRC, sorry but you were not the first jfx

Squad did this as it needed to be done, just be thankful they managed to get a decent deal from Amazon, someone there must play KSP

We're not using Amazon for the forums, as they're fairly low load and can be safely isolated. Amazon is expensive, so we'll only be using it for the two or three days during which we need the extra firepower, and then we'll drop down to the baseline servers.

Cheers.
